name: Tomb Raider II
description: The second instalment in the Tomb Raider series invites you to join Lara as she travels around the globe to retrieve a precious artefact before it falls into the wrong hands. The legendary artefact, the Dagger of Xian, is said to give its possessor the power of a fire breathing dragon.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP / Windows Vista / Windows 7 Processor:1.8 GHz Processor Memory:512 MB RAM Graphics:3D graphics card compatible with DirectX 9 DirectX®:9.0 Hard Drive:2 GB HD space

reviews.review_text: 10 out of 10  We join Lara on her second adventure Tomb Raider 2. One of the bestselling Tomb Raider games Tomb Raider 2 improves on the original, with new weapons like the harpoon gun, grenade launcher and M4, new graphic enhancements like gun flash and flairs. And for the first time in Tomb Raider Lara has a few costume changes along the way.  You join Lara on another globetrotting adventure to recover the dagger of Xian. A mythical dagger that would turn you into a dragon if you plunged it into your heart.  I feel that Tomb Raider 2 is one of the best Tomb Raider games of all time :)

Great second game for Lara Croft.  Graphics have been slightly updated from the first game, although it still looks pretty bad now days. This is quite a long game (i have yet to finish it, half way though at the time of this review) As with the first game, this isn't an easy one and there is a few timing jump that can be a bit tricky but the controls are very responsive. Worth noting, the expansion pack The Golden Mask isn't included in the Steam version Lastly, even if the game can be play at 1080p, it doesn't support widescreen resolution.

TLDR: Amazing story, fantastic level design, capturing puzzles... way too many baddies at the end of the game that detract from the experience  Tomb Raider II is an action/adventure that focuses heavily on puzzle solving and precarious platforming. Prepare to be jumping over large pits, avoiding rolling boulders, and shooting at seemingly random placed baddies. Also get ready to be hitting that save button a lot to avoid long and tedious do overs. This game has an AMAZING story and the level design is very well done. There is a really good balance between trying to find the hidden doors, the right buttons, and that one key you need to continue, and fighting the good variety of baddies that you'll be encountering. This game also had a little scare factor. With little to no background music, solving the puzzles can become quite relaxing until that BLARING alert music starts warning you of a nearby spawned enemy which had me jumping more than occasionally. This game however does have some drawbacks. The camera angles can be REALLY annoying and you'll be going around corners firing just to make sure there arent any enemies down that way. The number of enemies near the end of the game can also be a bit absurd and you'll need some fancy aerobics to avoid attacks and still getting the shots off you need.

The sequal to the original Tomb Raider offers new weapons, moves, and sets of vehicles to help you on your journey in obtaining the Dagger of Xian. Along this trek, you encounter an Italian mob who are also after the very item you seek. The slight improvements in this game, creates some new thrills. That said, the game is just as hard as the original, but still a rewarding experience to master. The thing I like most about the game is that the mansion level is more open than in the original that allows you to see more of Lara's home. Overrall, this is a good for anyone who likes the original.

This is my favorite tomb raider game, it's weird and gloomy, and like the other classics has the tank and block based controls that make the game feel so great and precise;  I love the overall weirdness that this one makes me feel, You need to be very careful with any movement of Lara, which makes for a very intimate experience overall. A simple mistep can cause you to fall and die many times, and there are moments of constant danger, like some underwater sections and such. It's just a bliss, very carefully made. I can't recomend enough ^_^

This old MS-DOS game still hasn't lost its fun. Sure, the graphics aren't much to look at compared with modern games. But if you look past that, the gameplay is excellent, and I think that Tomb Raider II is probably the game that got this franchise the breakthrough. Hours of fun with great puzzles, it just doesn't get old.
